Assessment.QuestionText: Which of these statements about controls and <font face="courier new">Control</font> class are true and which statements are false?

Options.Option: The basic controls are controls that include the <font face="courier new">RadioButton</font> and <font face="courier new">CheckBox</font> controls.
The selection list controls are controls that allow you to select a value from the list using the down arrows only.
The <font face="courier new">Control</font> class is the parent class of all graphic controls.
The <font face="courier new">Control</font> class is used to create custom controls.
The <font face="courier new">Visible</font > property of the <font face="courier new">Control</font> class is used to activate the control.

Assessment.CorrectFeedback: Yes, that’s correct! You get one point for your response.
Assessment.incorrectFeedback: No, that’s incorrect. The correct selections are: (A)–(False), (B)–(False), (C)–(True), (D)–(True), and (E)-(False).
